links_reviews_title: Nice Quality & Fit but Weird Length
links_reviews_text: I am personally a huge fan of Rollas jeans. I ordered up a size and they fit perfectly snug (I like my jeans on the tighter side). Sadly, this "crop" length basically hit right at my ankles and since they're flared it just looked dorky. I was hoping for them to be just a little more cropped. Would probably fit someone 5'8" and above perfectly cropped or someone 5'4" as regular jeans.

Wasn't sure how I felt about these at first, and here I am a month into quarantine and I've worn them practically every day. I CHOOSE to put these on instead of staying in my PJs. The material is super thick and structured, and I love the high waistline. Super flattering. I have a self described "pencil body" in that my waist and my hips are basically a straight line so if you have more hips the pants might be too restrictive. That said I could probably have gotten away with my usual 24 but everyone said to size up and given all the snacks I've been eating the 25s fit and are comfortable. Bought them!
Loved these, wore them a few times. I have short legs but the length worked great with chunky boots. Very flattering and the flare is fun.

Two words. BUYING these! I fell in love with the look and feel of these jeans the second I put them on. They're effortlessly comfy for jeans, and have the perfect color and high-waisted fit I was looking for. I don't typically wear flare jeans but have been looking to try, and these jeans were the perfect way to go if you are afraid to make the jump. For size comparison, the size was spot-on for me and I typically wear 4/6 in jeans from other brands. My go-to look was either wearing these jeans with a cropped tee or hoodie with Vans or pairing these with a flow-y top and casual boots!
Adorable, the color was perfect. Total LA hippie vibes
